poem:
Title: Horizon's Shadow

In the dawn of accusation,
Unjustly hung on bureaucratic wire,
The humble post-office bearers lament.
Sunak's late apology - a troubadour's song,
Hollinrake's penance echoes fleeting time.
Grim Horizon's electronic ghost,
Revealing malevolence and ineptitude
In stamps and letters, ink and sweat,
Acquittal comes, yet Integrity's silhouette
Never quite fades from the postmaster's door.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Responding to an urgent question about this after PMQs, Kevin Hollinrake, the postal services minster, said the inquiry into the scandal had shown that the Post Office acted". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
